case_vignette:
A 2-day old male newborn delivered vaginally at 36 weeks to a 29-year-old woman, gravida 3, para 2, has generalized convulsions lasting 2 minutes. Previous to the event, he had difficulty feeding and was lethargic. Pregnancy and delivery were uncomplicated. Apgar scores were 7 and 8 at 1 and 5 minutes, respectively. Pregnancy and delivery of the mother's first 2 children were also uncomplicated. Medications of the mother include folic acid and a multivitamin. The mother's immunizations are up-to-date. The infant appears icteric. His vital signs are within normal limits. The infant's weight and length are at the 5th percentile, and his head circumference at the 99th percentile for gestational age. There are several purpura of the skin. Ocular examination shows posterior uveitis. The patient does not pass his auditory screening tests. Cranial ultrasonography shows ventricular dilatation, as well as hyperechoic foci within the cortex, basal ganglia, and periventricular region. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis? 
A) Congenital CMV infection
B) Congenital toxoplasmosis
C) Congenital syphilis
D) 22q11.2 deletion syndrome
E) 22q11.2 deletion syndrome
F) 22q11.2 deletion syndrome
G) Congenital CMV infection
H) Congenital toxoplasmosis
I) Congenital syphilis
J) 22q11.2 deletion syndrome
K) 22q11.2 deletion syndrome
L) 22q11.2 deletion syndrome
M) Congenital CMV infection
N) Congenital toxoplasmosis
O) Congenital syphilis
P) 22q11.2 deletion syndrome
Q) 22q11.2 deletion syndrome
R) 22q11.2 deletion syndrome
S) Congenital CMV infection
T) Congenital toxoplasmosis
U) Congenital syphilis
V) 22q11.2 deletion syndrome
W) 22q11.2 deletion syndrome
X) 22q11.2 deletion syndrome
Y) Cong
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. I had difficulty feeding and was very tired, and I also experienced a shaking episode that lasted for about 2 minutes.
How old are you?
I am 2 days old.
Does your family have any history of neurological disorders or metabolic diseases?
There is no mention of a family history of neurological disorders or metabolic diseases in my family.
Were there any complications during pregnancy or delivery?
No, the pregnancy and delivery were uncomplicated.
Do you have any abnormalities in your blood sugar levels?
There is no information provided about my blood sugar levels.
Has there been any testing or observation for possible infections?
Yes, an ocular examination showed signs of posterior uveitis.
**Final Diagnosis:** Congenital toxoplasmosis.
